snippet: The Uzbek government, lobbied by rights groups and pressured quietly by the United States to free a high-profile political prisoner, has finally revealed a secret: he died five years ago.
abstract: Uzbek officials announce Akram Yuldashev, political prisoner due for release in 2016, actually died in 2010; country had been under pressure from human rights advocates and American officials to release leader who argued Islamic principles could assist transition from communism to capitalism.
lead_paragraph: The Uzbek government, lobbied by rights groups and pressured quietly by the United States to free a high-profile political prisoner, has finally revealed a secret: he died five years ago.

headline.main: Uzbeks Say Inmate Due for Release Died in 2010
headline.print_headline: Uzbeks Say Inmate Due for Release Died in 2010

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
